snippet: Senator Malcolm A. Smith, who has been charged in a plot to bribe his way onto the ballot to run for mayor of New York, says his trial would interfere with his re-election campaign.
abstract: Office of United States attorney for Southern District of New York opposes request by New York State Senator Malcolm A Smith, who has been charged in a plot to bribe his way onto the ballot to run for mayor of New York City, to delay his corruption trial; Smith argues trial would interfere with his re-election campaign.
lead_paragraph: Senator Malcolm A. Smith, who has been charged in a plot to bribe his way onto the ballot to run for mayor of New York, says his trial would interfere with his re-election campaign.

headline.main: Legislator Up for Re-election Wants to Delay Bribery Trial
headline.print_headline: Legislator Up for Re-election Wants to Delay Bribery Trial
